executiveSynthesis.quarterOverview: Q1 2025 presented a global sales environment defined by acute market bifurcation with strong resilience in Asia-Pacific contrasting sharply with macroeconomic deceleration in Western economies.
keyHeadwinds: Sharp consumer spending pullback in Western markets
Manufacturing sector pressure with near-zero export growth expectations
strategicImperatives: Focus on corporate resilience sales rather than M&A
Implement regional retail selectivity in U.S. markets

inflationOutlook.marginPressure: Manufacturers expect to pass on only 3.6% price increases to consumers

consumerSentiment.unemployment: U.S. rate expected to rise above 4.5% by Q3 2025
consumerSentiment.demandPattern: Significant front-loading of demand into Q4 2024

keyDrivers: Transport services (10% global growth, China leading with 31%)

europe.outlook: Significant deceleration mirroring North American trends

technology.strategicShift: Focus on digital transformation CapEx (supply chain resilience, CX)
